ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY_ADDITIONAL.OFFICIALNAME: Ørsted Bioenergy and Thermal Power A/S

TITLE.P: Tender for Legal Services Denmark Framework Agreement

SHORT_DESCR.P: The contracting entity is tendering for a framework agreement (“Framework Agreement”) divided into six (6) lots.
The tenderer can bid for one or more lots. The Framework Agreements will feature a duration of two (2) years, plus two (2) options to extend for one (1) year.
• Lot 1: Full service except for areas of law covered by lot N. 2 to 6
• Lot 2: Financial regulation
• Lot 3: Oil pipeline infrastructure
• Lot 4: Contracts for sale and purchase of gas
• Lot 5: GDPR
• Lot 6: Competition law, EU tender law and state aid.

TITLE.P: Lot 1: Full Service Except for Areas of Law Covered by Lot No 2 to 6

SHORT_DESCR.P: This lot covers all services not covered by lot 2 (Financial regulation); lot 3 (Oil pipeline infrastructure); lot 4 (Contracts for sale and purchase of gas), lot 5 (GDPR); and lot 6 (Competition law, EU tender law and state aid). However, services directly or indirectly related to M&A transactions or other comparable transactions will always be covered by lot 1 and not any of the individual lots. Thus, if e.g. a merger filing to the relevant competition authorities is needed, the filing shall be prepared by the supplier under lot 1, cf. below in section 8, and not the supplier of lot 6.
The contracting entity intends to award 2 suppliers with a Framework Agreement under lot 1, cf. section 8 for call offs under the agreements.

INFO_ADD.P: The envisaged number of applicants (5) is not a maximum number as this is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III.1.4) may submit a tender.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 2: Financial regulation
Advice and assistance in relation to:

— financial regulation, currently in the form of REMIT (EU Regulation 1227/2011), MAR (EU Regulation 596/2014), MiFID (EU Directive 65/2014), EMIR (EU Regulation 648/2012), SFTR (EU Regulation 2365/2015) and anti-money laundering and any rules, regulations or guidelines related thereto;
— framework agreements in the form of EFET standard agreements, REPOS, Security Lending agreements, CSAs and ISDA standard agreements;
— knowledge sharing and sparring.
The contracting entity intends to award 1 supplier with a Framework Agreement.

INFO_ADD.P: The envisaged number of applicants (3) is not a maximum number as this is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III.1.4) may submit a tender.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 3: Oil pipeline infrastructure

Advice and assistance in connection with oil infrastructure and associated activities, including e.g. the activities of Danish Oil Pipe A/S, sector specific regulation of the oil pipeline from the North Sea to Frederica and associated facilities. Knowledge sharing and sparring is also an integral part.
The Contracting entity intends to award 1 supplier with a Framework Agreement.

INFO_ADD.P: The envisaged number of applicants (3) is not a maximum number as this is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III.1.4) may submit a tender.

TITLE.P: Lot 4: Contracts for Sale and Purchase of Gas

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 4: Contracts for sale and purchase of gas

Advice and assistance related to long term sales and purchase contracts for gas; gas infrastructure and associated facilities including e.g. the gassification facility in Nybro, infrastructure for import to and export of gas from Denmark, and assistance naturally related hereto. Knowledge sharing and sparring is also an integral part.
The contracting entity intends to award 1 supplier with a Framework Agreement.

INFO_ADD.P: The envisaged number of applicants (3) is not a maximum number as this is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III.1.4) may submit a tender.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 5: GDPR
Advice and assistance related to GDPR and the Danish rules on the topic, including:
Ad-hoc support and advice on:
— personal data issues,
— compliance related issues in respect of processes, policies and internal controls,
— data breaches,
— requests from data subjects,
— complaint cases before the Danish Data Protection Agency (in Danish ‘Datatilsynet’),
— audits from the Danish Data Protection Agency, and
— knowledge sharing and sparring.
The contracting entity intends to award 1 supplier with a Framework Agreement.

INFO_ADD.P: The envisaged number of applicants (3) is not a maximum number as this is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III.1.4) may submit a tender.

TITLE.P: Lot 6: Competition Law, EU Tender Law and State Aid

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lot 6: Competition law, EU tender law and state aid
Advice and assistance related to competition law, EU and Danish tender law (primarily Utilities Directive) and state aid including:
advice on:

— competition law: assessment of agreements (e.g. information sharing and horizontal agreements), new practices and products/services of Ørsted, definition of the relevant market, interpretation of regulations, laws and case law (Danish and EU level) including responsa, complaints cases (if any), knowledge sharing and sparring;

— tender law: assistance with or in connection with preparation of tender documents and letters including amendments to Ørsted’s standards, interpretation of regulations, laws and case law (Danish and EU level) including responsa, complaints cases (if any), knowledge sharing and sparring;

— state aid: assistance in connection with Ørsted acting as a bidder, interpretation of regulations, guidelines etc. and case law (EU level) including responsa, complaints cases (if any), knowledge sharing and sparring.
— a combination of the above, e.g. joint ventures with third parties involving issues within two or more areas covered by this lot.
The scope of assignments varies a lot.
The contracting entity intends to award 1 supplier with a Framework Agreement.

INFO_ADD.P: The envisaged number of applicants (3) is not a maximum number as this is an open procedure with negotiation, where everyone who meets the minimum requirements stated in in III.1.4) may submit a tender.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: • Lot 1: It is a minimum requirement for participation, that the tenderer employs at least 100 lawyers as of 1 January 2020 (in Danish: ‘Advokater’) in offices in Denmark.

• Lot 1-6: It is a minimum requirement for participation that a majority of the tenderer’s employees carrying out the tasks covered by each of the lots are fluent in the Danish language and are registered at the Danish Bar and Law Society.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: The framework agreement will be awarded to the most economically advantageous tender and identified based on the best price-quality ratio.

INFO_ADD.P: The contracting entity reserves the right during negotiations to nominate a short list of tenderers for additional negotiations. The short list will be comprised of the tenderers whose tenders (BAFOs) at the time are considered the most economically advantageous pursuant to the award criteria. With reference to ‘II.1.5) Estimated total value’ and ‘II.2.6) Estimated value’: The estimated yearly spend for all entities who can make call offs under the Framework Agreement is DKK 50 000 000. The estimated yearly spend is based on among other things historical data and our expectations to the future. The estimated total amount is indicative, and the aggregated purchases made under the Framework Agreement may vary from the estimated total amount. Unforeseen circumstances might occur if for instance new projects, strategic changes or new needs arise. Therefore, the contracting entity has decided to also include an envisaged total maximum amount. The envisaged total maximum amount for all entities who can make call offs under the Framework Agreement is DKK 200 000 000.
Applicants in a consortium will be jointly and severally liable to the contracting entity for the fulfilment of the contract.
